title: The Girl He Never Noticed
author: sweetdreamer33
First published: Sep 28, 2014
status: Completed
description: Meet Jade. 
The girl who wore a black wig, black-rimmed big eyeglasses and braces. She was dressed in her worn-out knitted coat and shapeless vintage clothes. Everyone thought that she was a weirdo, a nerd or a girl resurrected from the past. She was used to be the laughing stock of everyone.

But who was really Jade Collins? Why did she hide her real outer beauty? What happened when her boss, the great Eros Petrakis, finally noticed her? Could she tame the beast inside him?

Meet Eros. 
The man who had everything in life. Devilishly handsome, very powerful, brilliant, extremely rich, and had a body that women loved to worship. But, despite all that positive attributes, he was also very ruthless, tyrant, cold and heartless.  He was his colleagues' and enemies' worst nightmare. They thought his name was another four-letter word of EVIL. He never smiled; never said 'please' and never apologized for his mistakes. His employees feared him most. He fired them in just a snap of his fingers.

What made him finally noticed Jade? How would he react when he sees the beautiful woman behind the big black wig and dark-rimmed eyeglasses?

Enjoy reading the story of Eros and Jade in 'THE GIRL HE NEVER NOTICED.' Join them in their journey in facing their trials in life, overcoming the shadows of their pasts, and finally finding love and happiness.

Be inspired in their story. Laugh, Cry, Giggle and Feel in Love with them.

                          THE GIRL HE NEVER NOTICED
                          By: sweetdreamer33
                           Meet Jade.
                          The girl who wore a black wig, black-rimmed big eyeglasses, braces and old-fashioned clothes. Everyone thought that she was a weirdo, a nerd or a girl resurrected from the past. She was used to be the laughing stock of everyone.
                          But who was really Jade Collins? Why did she hide her real outer beauty? What happened when her boss, the great Eros Petrakis, finally noticed her? Could she tame the beast inside him?
                          
                          Meet Eros.
                          The man who had everything in life. Devilishly handsome, very powerful, brilliant, extremely rich, and had a body that women loved to worship. But, despite all that positive attributes, he was also very ruthless, tyrant, cold and heartless.  He was his colleagues' and enemies' worst nightmare. They thought his name was another four-letter word of EVIL. He never smiled; never said 'please' and never apologized for his mistakes. His employees feared him most. He fired them in just a snap of his fingers.
                          What made him finally noticed Jade? How would he react when he sees the woman behind the big black wig and dark-rimmed eyeglasses?
                          
                          Enjoy reading the story of Eros and Jade in 'THE GIRL HE NEVER NOTICED.' Join them in their journey in facing their trials in life, overcoming the shadows of their pasts, and finally finding love and happiness.
                           Be inspired in their story. Laugh, Cry, Giggle and Feel in Love with them.
                          
                           Here's a quote that captivated my attention from Pinterest, I just want to share this to you all:
                           "I always find beauty in things that are odd and imperfect - they are much more interesting." --- Marc Jacobs
                          Well, I'm not saying that Jade is odd. But I would love a man who will love a girl not because of her outer beauty, but because of her heart -- her inner beauty.

Chapter One

CHAPTER ONE (unedited) 
                          - kindly put your playlist here -
                          "The beauty of a woman is not in the clothes she wears, the figure that she carries, or the way she combs her hair. The beauty of a woman is seen in her eyes, because that is the doorway to her heart, the place where love resides. True beauty in a woman is reflected in her soul. It's the caring that she lovingly gives the passion that she shows & the beauty of a woman only grows with passing years." --- Audrey Hepburn
                          
                          Jade's POV
                          "Good morning, Mrs. Chang. Did you sleep well last night?" I greeted my employer happily, Mrs. Grace Chang, a 65 year-old widow. I was concerned because she often had severe headaches and couldn't sleep well at night.
                          Mrs. Chang owned the small Coffee shop, in Manhattan, New York, where I got my family's bread and butter. I worked from eight a.m. till eight p.m. Monday to Friday as a cashier.
                          The place was understaff, so I often worked all around. I did the waitressing, coffee preparation, and sometimes cleaning the place after work. I couldn't complain, since Mrs. Chang was paying me well. Actually, not so well, but enough for my family to eat a decent meal every day and pay off the bills.
                          "Hi Jade, yes, I did. The pain reliever I took last night finally worked." She smiled adoringly at me.
                          "That's good. What did the doctor say?" I asked while putting my worn-out leather bag and old knitted coat inside a closet, and then I adjusted my black wig and took off my eyeglasses, to clean the lenses.
                          "It's just a migraine, nothing serious."
                          I was relieved that finally she listened to me. I told her several times to seek medical attention, but she wouldn't. She had a phobia of hospitals, medical clinics, syringes and doctors. She probably had a traumatic experience when she was a kid.
                          "George's wife had a normal delivery last night."
                          "Really? I'm so happy for them, after five years of trying, they finally have a baby. It's a girl, right?" I instantly became so excited for George, the barista.
                          "Yes, it is. Anyway, he can't report today. Could you fill in his place?"
                          OH. That would mean doing two jobs at the same time. Whew!
                          "Okay, no problem about that Mrs. Chang. I can manage." I smiled at her assuredly and fixed my crumpled brown floral vintage dress. Actually, it was my favorite dress and loved wearing it often. It belonged to my grandmother, as well as most of the dresses in my closet.
                          It was already eight o'clock, and time for the Coffee Shop to open. I wondered why the other employees, Suzanne and Kurt hadn't arrived yet. Suzanne was the waitress, who took the order and served the food. Kurt cleaned the tables, the floor and the bathroom.
                          Recently, I found out that Suzanne and Kurt were lovers. I caught them making out inside the bathroom. They forgot to lock the door.
                          "You retard! Don't tell Mrs. Chang about this or I'm going to break your bones." Kurt threatened me. He even twisted my arm behind my back. A tear suddenly fell on my cheek because of the burning pain.
                          "I won't, I promise. Let me go, please." I pleaded and finally he let go of my arm.
                          "Good. Remember that." His eyes were glaring at me angrily.
                          I rubbed my arm, it was so sore and my flesh turned red.
                          "Now, go, ugly monkey. You're not wanted here." Suzanne laughed and pushed me out of the bathroom.


Yup, they often bullied me, calling me names and I was used to it. I pretended not to hear their hurtful words. I just avoided messing up with them. I needed my job so badly and my family relied on me, besides Mrs. Chang was a good employer.
                          "Jade, I'll be in the kitchen. Just call me if you need help."
                          "Sure Mrs. Chang." I put on a black apron, getting ready for the first customer. I went inside the bar counter and turned on, the electronic cash register, as well as the coffee machines.
                          I learned how to prepare coffee from George, the barista. For almost a year that I'd been working in the coffee shop, he taught me how to do the coffee art works and the techniques in preparing a very good espresso. I learned the barista's complete guide to coffee and embraced the knowledge wholeheartedly.
                          I was cleaning the bar counter when the first customers came inside. Two men wearing black suit and dark glasses entered the coffee shop. They reminded me of the movie, 'Men in Black.'
                          I looked at the tall-clad figure of the man who came in first. He was younger than the other man. He halted at the front door and his eyes scanned the room. He stood there, tall, devilishly handsome, with a beautifully proportioned body.
                          I froze. My mind stopped working and my body turned numb. Something about his appearance disturbed me. He looked vaguely familiar.
                          Is he a movie star, a model or a celebrity? He was probably into sports, because of his athletic physique.
                          His dark glasses hid his eyes. It was impossible to find out where his eyes were focusing on. But I was certain that he was not looking at me. He carried himself with a commanding air of self confidence. He looked very powerful and extremely rich.
                          He said something to the other man, and then they strode in the room. They took their seats in the center of the room.
                          I grabbed a pen and the order slip pad. I hurriedly went towards them to take their order.
                          "Good morning, what's your order, sir?" I stood in front of the two men and smiled at them. I wrote C#1, shortcut for customer number one in the order slip.
                          "Good morning. Can we have a cup of espresso and a café latte?" The older man removed his dark glasses and smiled at me. He was probably in his mid forties.
                          My hands were trembling when I wrote their order. I didn't know why, perhaps because of the younger man's appearance. He looked like a very important man. His face was bronzed by wind and sun. The set of his chin suggested a stubborn streak and his lips were firm and sensual.
                          He made me so edgy and nervous as hell, and he didn't even seem to notice me. He was very busy talking on the phone. I couldn't help listening to his voice. It was so deep, with velvet-edge and strong.
                          "Is there anything else, sir?" My eyes shifted from one man to another.
                          "That's all, Miss." The older man replied, then nodding at me, a sign of dismissal.
                          I served their coffee within five minutes. I stared at the younger man again. He seemed really familiar. I was sure I'd seen him before. I wished he would take off his dark glasses so I could see his eyes, and figured out where I saw him. Then I noticed, he drank his coffee. The cup of espresso was his.
                          A few customers came in. I became so busy taking their orders and prepared their coffee. But I couldn't help glancing at the two men sitting in the center of the room, from time to time. I tried to ignore them and focused on my job.
                          After a while, I saw two girls approached the two men. The girls were giggling flirtatiously at them. The younger man looked at them and said something that made the faces of the girls turned sour. He probably said something very insulting, since the girls immediately went out of the coffee shop with stony faces. Well, he was rude.


The men left without asking for their bill. I went to the table, they earlier occupied and saw a one hundred dollar bill under the espresso cup.
                          What! A hundred dollar bill? I couldn't believe it. I was over the moon! They left too much tip for the coffee.
                          Later that morning, Suzanne and Kurt called simultaneously that they were sick. So, I was with Mrs. Chang in the coffee shop the whole day. She took my place on the cash register. I did the rest of the job. I tried to serve the customers so fast, so they would stop complaining about the slow service.
                          Before I went home, I mopped the floor and scrubbed the bathroom. I was so tired, but I didn't have a choice.
                          It was already eight thirty when I left the coffee shop. I took a bus to the South Bronx, where my family rented a small one-bedroom apartment. The moment I was seated in the bus, I ate the burger that I grabbed near the bus stop. After eating, I took a power nap.
                          "Guess what Mom. I got a very big tip today. Two rich-looking men left a hundred dollar bill for their coffee."
                          "What? That's too much." My mother, Ruby Collins narrowed her eyes.
                          "Yeah, I couldn't believe it. I told Mrs. Chang that we could split the tip, but she said that it was all mine."
                          "Awe... she's so sweet."
                          "Yeah, very sweet. I'm lucky to have her as my employer." I took my wig off and pulled the rubber band that held my hair in a bun. My long silky red hair instantly cascaded down to my waist. I took a hairbrush and combed my hair, until it shone.
                          "How's baby Hannah?" I asked about our neighbor's baby. Mom worked as a babysitter for almost a year now.
                          "She's still very adorable, but getting heavier. I don't think I can handle her anymore." Mom rubbed her chest. She had a mild coronary heart disease. It started six months ago. She was advised by her physician not to do strenuous activities.
                          "Then stop babysitting. I don't really want you to work. You are risking your health. Don't worry, I have a job. I'll work during weekends too, to have an extra money. We can manage."
                          "You're working too hard for us, Jade. I'm so sorry for being a burden to you."
                          "Mom, please don't say that again. I love you and I'll take care of you and Sapphire. I promised dad that I will." I hugged my mom, with moisture in my eyes.
                          Dad died of stage four lung cancer two years ago. I was eighteen at that time. He got it when he worked in an asbestos manufacturing company. A year before he died was the most traumatic year in our lives. We fought for his life. We lost our little savings and our cottage, just to keep up the medical expenses. It was like a nightmare, seeing dad's health deteriorated. He was a good man without vices, God-fearing, jolly person, and full of vitality, a very loving husband and caring father to us. I couldn't help but wondered why the good and godly people passed away earlier than their time.
                          The day when we finally lost dad, our world collapsed. We were so dependent on him. We looked up on him and solely relied on him financially.
                          "What's wrong?" My sister Sapphire went out of the bedroom. She shrieked with panic seeing me and mom hugging. She thought something bad happened again.
                          "Nothing really. We just want to hug each other. We miss dad." I smiled at my fifteen-year old sister, showing my braced teeth.
                          "Oh! I thought something bad happened. Anyway, Jade, I have news for you."
                          "What is it?"
                          "I was chatting with Joseph an hour ago."
                          "Joseph?"
                          "Yup, your one and only love!"
                          "What?"
                          "He asked for your Facebook account, and I told him you didn't have any social media accounts anymore. Then he asked for your phone number."
                          "Did you give it to him?"
                          "No! You said not to give your number to anyone, right?"
                          "Right."
                          "But he gave me his number. He asked you to call him, anytime. He'll be waiting."
                          I heaved a sigh. Joseph.
                          It had been two years since I last saw him. I totally cut our communication.
                          No. I can't face him anymore. I'm not the same girl that he used to know. I'm different, totally different now. The old Jade was gone, dead and buried. 
                          A flash of wild grief ripped inside me.

Chapter Two

CHAPTER TWO
                          --- Pls. put your playlist here ---
                          "You don't love someone because they're perfect, you love them in spite of the fact that they're not."  ― Jodi Picoult, My Sister's Keeper
                          Eros' POV
                          "Hi. Um... I'm Gretchen." The girl who wore black miniskirt and gray shirt with a plunging neckline giggled. Her eyes were flirtatious, batting her thick false eyelashes at me.
                          "I'm Summer." The other girl flashed her even white teeth. Her bright red lipstick made her lips popped out.
                          "Yes?" Donovan frowned, asking the girls what they wanted.
                          "Um... would you mind, if we join you?"
                          Donovan looked around, checking for a vacant table. He cleared his throat and smiled at them. "There are still a lot of vacant tables around."
                          Both girls flushed and then giggled, eyeing at me.
                          "Actually, um... we just want to introduce ourselves." The girl called Summer, swayed her hips and bent a little to flaunt her cup DD breast size.
                          "Ok. I'm Bond. James Bond." I heard Donovan introduce himself. I was amused, my eyebrows rose at him. I was still on the phone, giving instructions to my executive secretary.
                          The two girls lifted their eyebrows, and then shrugged their shoulders.
                          "Um... what's his name?" One girl pointed her forefinger at me.
                          "Stark. Tony Stark."
                          I almost choked on my coffee when I heard him say Iron Man's name.
                          "Your're kidding, right? He couldn't be Iron man."
                          "Whatever." The girl with a red lipstick looked at me with puppy eyes.
                          "Um... we're wondering if you could hang out with us later. Go to the mall, watch a movie, and then go to a bar or something."
                          "We're very busy, girls. We have a lot of work to do. We don't have the time for that." I heard Donovan rejected their offer lightly.
                          "Ohh.... That's so boring."
                          "Ya, and very lame excuse. I'm sure, your boss wouldn't mind." The other girl stomped her feet childishly.
                          I had enough with them. I turned off my phone and faced the girl who stomped her feet. "Awww, it's so cute when you try to talk about things you don't understand. I bet the smartest thing that have ever come out of your mouth was a pe*is."
                          The girls glared at me and then looked at each other's eyes. It took them a while to register that I insulted them. With furious eyes, they stormed out of the coffee shop.
                          Donovan Grant, who was more than just my personal driver and bodyguard, drove my Bugatti Veyron this morning. I had a hangover. I drank too much alcohol last night. I attended a friend's birthday party. The crowd was full of socialites and celebrities. It was rather wild. Damn it! I even brought a girl in my apartment. Not just any girl, but the famous model, Kendra Packer.
                          I usually dated a girl thrice before bringing her in my apartment. But last night, when Kendra Packer was introduced to me, she wouldn't leave my side. She was clutching my arm all the time. I didn't have a reason to complain, because she was smoking' hot and gorgeous. Every man in the party wanted her. And she knew her prowess to attract every single man that was why she was very confident that she could have me.
                          She was marvelous in bed, an expert in every position. I was shocked how she often brought me to the edge of ecstasy. She knew how to turn a man on, the pleasure points that drove a man crazy. Damn! How did she learn all of that?


"To the office Sir?" Donovan's voice brought me back to the present.
                          "Yup." I leaned back on the passenger seat, feeling lightheaded.
                          Hmm, that was a delicious espresso, in fact, the most delicious espresso that I've ever tasted. 
                          I spotted the coffee shop earlier on our way to the office when I had a sudden urge to drink another cup of coffee. I blamed my hangover for it, it was killing me. My head throbbed and I had red blood shot eyes.
                          "We'll drop by again in that coffee shop tomorrow."
                          "Yes Sir." I saw Donovan smile through my peripheral vision. I bet he enjoyed his coffee too.
                          Donovan was in his early forties, once a kickboxing champion and undergone Executive Protection and Bodyguard Training. He was more than just my driver-bodyguard. Their family had been working in our mansion, ever since. He was often hanging out with me when I was a kid, and he was a teenager at that time. We got along very well. I treated him like my older brother.
                          Aside from my best friend, Iñigo Monteiro, Donovan knew the real me. Sometimes, more than my family did. He was the first one to know that I was bullied in school when I was in 4th grade. The other kids bullied me because I was the richest kid in school, the heir of a multi-billion company, properties and assets. Besides, I looked like a walking stick before, so tall and thin.
                          Donovan often saw me cry in our house's basement. I became miserable and didn't want to go to school because of the bullying. I even started hating my family and myself for being born rich.
                          One Saturday afternoon, when my parents had their vacation in Hawaii, Donovan taught me kickboxing. He showed me how to kick, punch and practice self-defense. I started enjoying the sport a lot. I was so determined to learn and master the sport. Eventually, it helped me to become strong and gained weight. Since then, he had given me intensive training every weekend, and most oftentimes with my best friend, Iñigo.
                          I started gaining confidence in school. I knew I could beat every boy in my class. Some of them still bullied me, but I promised to Donovan not to use what I learned in kickboxing, unless someone started it for me. But when the leader of the group, Dexter, who often bullied me kicked my ass so hard, I lost my patience. I immediately grabbed his shirt and punched his face so hard. He was instantly knocked down and scrambling up from the ground. He attempted to punch me back, but I was so quick in kicking his face. His mouth bled and his nose was broken.
                          Since that day, the bullying stopped. Everyone feared of crossing with me. They were scared of making me angry. But, on that day, I was brought to the principal's office, as well as my parents. My classmates testified that I was often bullied by Dexter, so, in the end, I got our principal's sympathy, and forgave me for what I did.
                          When I became a teenager, Donovan was with me when I fought to become stupidly independent. He saw me getting so drunk in the bar with my friends, tried a drug, did meaningless sex with someone, going to strip clubs, etc. He still saw me getting vulnerable sometimes. He knew every time I messed up and helped me get out of such mess.
                          As I grew up, he taught me a lot of things. Things that would make my family freak out. He taught me what he learned in Bodyguard and Security Training School. I mastered assembling different types of rifles and weapon tactics, assembling and dismantling bombs, etc. He was my partner in crime, my buddy and my friend. We raced cars and motorbike in maximum speed. We did dangerous sports, like volcano bungee jumping, Heli-skiing, high wave surfing, mysterious cave diving, etc. We were both the same, adventurous and fearless.
                          But, the Eros my family and relatives knew was a very different guy. They thought of me as brilliant, goal-oriented, confident, powerful, tough and not capable of doing silly things, the perfect man. They had a high regard of me, just like they did, with my ancestors, who were known as great men in their times.
                          Ever since I was born, they molded me to become a great man because I would rule the Petrakis fortune someday. I had the best tutor in academics and language. Aside from English, I learned to speak Greek, Portuguese, Spanish, French, Hindi, Filipino and Mandarin Chinese.
                          I graduated in Business Administration at Harvard University two years ago, at the age of twenty two. Since then, I had devoted my time in running our family business, the Petrakis International Holding Corporation, a multi-billion world shipping company. Just recently, I took my place as the Executive Vice President of our company.
                          I knew, some of my colleagues and employees believed the worst in me. Why? It was because I expected perfection from them, to be very skillful, efficient, excellent and productive in their jobs. They just didn't realize that I was doing this for their own good.
                          Our world was full of competitions. There were many hungry sharks businessmen out there, aiming to bring our organization down. They would even trade their souls just to see us crawling on the ground.
                          Never.
                          I wouldn't let our company fail. We have thousands of employees all over the globe who relied on us. They would starve, including their families if the organization suffered bankruptcy. No yearly increase in their salaries, no bonuses, no incentives and so on. I swore no one could ever bring us down.
                          The moment we arrived at the office building, the security guards greeted me. I nodded at them and went directly to the lobby, where my private elevator was. Many employees were there, some just arrived and the others waited for the elevator to open. The crowded and noisy area suddenly became solemn when I entered, like you were walking inside an empty church. The silence was deafening that you could hear a drop of coin on the floor. Each employee stood frozen on their feet. Their eyes riveted on me. Fear and anxiety were visible on their faces.
                          "Good morning, Mr. Petrakis."
                          "Good morning, Sir."
                          "Have a nice day, Sir."
                          Everyone greeted me. As usual, I just nodded my head and went directly to the elevator. This was an everyday scenario in the lobby and I was already used to it.
                          I stepped out of the elevator and walked towards my office. Donovan was following behind me.
                          A girl with black miniskirt, red blouse with a very plunging neckline and too bright red lipstick smiled at me.
                          "Good morning, Mr. Petrakis. I'm Viviene West, your new personal assistant." She was batting her thick false eyelashes at me.
                          I looked at her, and then snapped my fingers. I immediately went inside my office.
                          "Miss West, you've just been fired." I heard Donovan said.

Chapter Three

 Chapter Three
                          -Kindly put your playlist here-
                          "There are no rules when it comes to love. I just try to let love surprise me because you never know who you're going to fall in love with. You never know who's going to come into your life – and for me, when I picture the person I want to end up with, I don't think about what their career is, or what they look like. I picture the feeling I get when I'm with them."  ― Taylor Swift
                          Jade's POV
                          "Wait! Please wait!" I shouted at the top of my lungs and ran towards the bus stop. But the bus driver didn't hear me, and closed the door.
                          "No!" Panting, trembling, breathless, I groaned with disappointment. The bus left, when I was just a few steps away from the bus stop. Now, I had to wait for another ten to fifteen minutes for the next bus. I would be late for work, which never ever happened before. I felt so tired last night that I overslept. I was so stupid, I forgot to set the alarm clock.
                          I dug out my phone in my bag to text Mrs. Chang that I would be late. I was scrolling my phone's contacts when I came across Joseph's number. I stored his number last night, despite having no intention of calling him.
                          Joseph Nevin was our neighbor in New Jersey. Blond, cute with dimples, tall and lean. He looked like the young Brad Pitt. Aside from his good looks, he was also smart, very humble, God-fearing and very compassionate.

To be honest, I sometimes forgot following my OB's advised to alleviate the feeling of nausea in the morning: to munch on crackers in the morning before sitting up on bed and lying in bed for 15 to 20 minutes to help absorb the gastric juices in the stomach and bring up my blood sugar... etc.

                          I enjoyed bothering her. It was the only way that she would notice me. She was shy, aloof and very silent in school. She made friends with the girls only. 
                          Yeah. I liked her. A lot. From the moment they moved in beside our house a year ago. I saw her from my window. Her room was across mine. 
                          One time, our eyes met through our windows. That was really awkward. I did the first thing that came into my mind. To hide and slowly closed the blinds.
                          "Quack... quack...  quack..." I said, riding my skateboard and following Maddie.
                          Maddie stopped walking and faced me again. "What am I, a duck?!" She looked really angry now.
                          I shrugged my shoulders. "What did I do?"
                          "Quack... quack... quack..." She mimicked me. "Stop following me. You're annoying!"
                          "I'm not following you. This is my way home." I said, enjoying her expression now.
                          She spun around and walked again. I followed her.
                          "Oink... oink... oink..." I said, laughing.
                          She stopped. When she faced me, I could sense that she was ready to explode. She moved towards me and gave me a sudden blow on my eye.

Now Available on Wattpad
                          Zion Petrakis' Story

                          The Boy I Admire From Afar #TBIAFA
                          By: Neilani Alejandrino a.k.a. 
                          sweetdreamer33
                          
                          Claire Olsen had a great crush on Zion Petrakis since the first time she laid eyes on him. But Zion had his eyes glued at the school's 'It girl' Maddie Jennings. Claire couldn't compete with Maddie who was every boy's dream girl in school. She hid her feelings for Zion and just satisfied admiring him from afar.
                          But a series of events led Claire closer to Zion in middle school and that made her feelings for him intensified- growing from infatuation to love. She tried to act normal and fought hard to hide her feelings when they were together. At some points, she avoided him, but the more barrier she put between them, the more he barged into her ordered life.
                          Meet the other characters of the story: Izzy, Harry, Maddie, London and the Petrakis Family - Eros, Jade, Emerald and other sweetdreamer33 characters.

Book II - Chapter 13

Chapter Thirteen (UNEDITED)
                          
                          --Kindly put your playlist here--
                          
                          "Sometimes the questions are complicated and the answers are simple." ― Dr. Seuss
                          
                          Zion's POV
                          "I don't understand. Your parents are both Petrakis. How come you're a Gonzales?" 
                          My body suddenly went rigid. My best friend, Harry finally found the guts to ask the question that I've been dreading to answer.
                          "See? A big P. Petakis." Harry touched the glossy metal of the letter P in the middle of our mansion's iron gate. 
                          Ours. Or theirs?
                          "It's a complicated story man." I said to Harry, trying to dismiss the topic.
                          Mom always said that I'm her son. She got pregnant when she was eighteen. And my dad, Eros Petrakis, is my real dad.
                          Is that true? I still don't understand. 
                          I didn't have any baby pictures with them, just like Emeralds that were scattered in her room and in the living room. Emerald have pictures of her blowing candles since her first birthday. Mine started when I was five.
                          The picture I had with mom and dad started during their wedding. I was there in almost every picture, with them. 
                          I was five years old when I started kindergarten class. I learned to write my name using Gonzales as my surname. I was seven years old when I realized that my dad's and mom's surname was Petrakis. But I did not mind. I thought it was fine, not a big deal. But last year, it started to bother me. Emerald started school and she was also a Petrakis. 
                          How come I have two parents? My dad Eros and my mom Jade. And there's my papa Roberto and my mama Edna?
                          I asked my mom, Jade about it. She said that it was a very complicated story. When I grew up, I would understand everything. But as of now, I have to bear in mind that I am their biological son. She carried me for nine months in her tummy. I have her blood and my dad Eros' in my body. Emerald was the same, because we have the same parents. Therefore, we were a family.
                          But still, she hadn't answer my question. Why am I a Gonzales?
                          I asked her again and her answer made me so confused.
                          "I couldn't take care of you at that time so I asked for help. The Gonzales were so kind, they took care of you. We've just lost dad and we have no money. I have to find a job so we wouldn't starve... and of course pay the monthly bills... the house rental, electricity, gas and water... that sort of thing.  Your grandma Ruby was so sick, she couldn't work and your aunt Sapphire was only 15, she was still in senior high."
                          "But what about dad? Was he busy too?"
                          "Um... he was always away... in business."
                          "Why would you starve? Dad is rich."
                          "Ah... um... we're not living together at that time." Mom stammered.
                          "Why not? Where was he?"
                          "Um... away..."
                          "Where? Can't you find a nanny at that time?"
                          "No... it was hard to find a good nanny."
                          "What about grandma Nina? She's always not busy."


"Yeah... but... It's really complicated. When you grew up you will understand better."
                          "So I have to wait when I grow up."
                          "Yeah. And I can explain it to you better."
                          "Okay mom." I said, feeling so dissatisfied.
                          My dad Eros version of the story was different. 
                          "Why am I a Gonzales dad?"
                          "Huh? You're a Petrakis." Dad and I were in the breakfast table. He was sipping his coffee.
                          "You know what I mean dad. In school, I'm Zion Gonzales. But when I'm with my family, I'm Zion Petrakis. I'm getting so confused."
                          "Ah, okay." He said checking the time on his wrist. "I'm still working on it. I already asked Roberto if we could change you surname to Petrakis. Do you like that?"
                          "Yeah. But why am I a Gonzales? Not Petrakis like you, mom and Emerald?"
                          He checked his watch again. "Okay here's the story. Your mom and I met and we instantly fell in love. We were young and so... reckless. We slept together then we have you. I was gone... for years."
                          "Where did you go?"
                          "Somewhere... away... that I lost communication with your mom."
                          "No phone or internet in that place?"
                          "Yeah."
                          "So what happened next? How did I end up being a Gonzales?"
                          "Roberto and Edna took care of you because your mom was sick."
                          "Sick? A cancer just like Mama Edna?
                          "NO!" Dad's eyes opened and his relaxed body went rigid. He instantly knocked the wooden table three times. "She's not sick, just a little sad because she lost her dad. She couldn't take care of you."
                          "Okay... so..."
                          "Because the Gonzales took care of you, they registered your name as Zion Gonzales. But you are a Petrakis. One hundred percent. Roberto and I will arrange to correct your surname next week. Okay?"
                          I nodded. 
                          I have no doubt that my dad Eros and mom Jade were my real parents. Many people said that I looked like my dad. I could even see the resemblance every time I saw a mirror. 
                          "I'll see you tomorrow Zion. We'll catch more rare Pokémon." Harry said. Bringing my mind back to the present.
                          "Sure." I carried my skateboard and went inside the iron gate. 
                          My aunt Sapphire was in the kitchen, raiding again the fridge. I liked her. She was young and smart. I learned many cool stuffs from her and her boyfriend, uncle Kobe.
                          "Hey, What's up?" She said, swinging her rainbow coloured long hair.
                          "Nothing."
                          "You look upset."
                          "I'm not. Just bothered."
                          "What about? Maybe I can help." She pulled a chair on the kitchen table then grabbed a bite of the sandwich she made. 
                          I put down my skateboard and sat beside my aunt. "Can you tell me why I'm a Gonzales? I mean the real story. Mom and Dad made me so confused. I know they're not telling me the whole truth."
                          "Ah.. so what do you wanna know?"
                          "I want to know what really happened."
                          "Haha! You'll get shocked."


"Why? Is it horrible?"
                          "Very. You have to be ready and open your mind. Don't judge your parents. We are all human beings and we are not perfect only God. We make many mistakes and failures. We even commit sins."
                          "Okay. I understand that."
                          "Remember. Don't judge them, okay?"
                          "Okay. I'm ready."
                          "Your mom got pregnant because she had a one-night stand with your dad. Shh... "
                          "Really?" I was so surprised hearing that.
                          "Yeah. They met in the bar. They both got drunk and had sex."
                          "What?!"
                          "You know what happened? She got pregnant right away. To think that she met your dad once!"
                          "Oh man..." I said.
                          "Your mom got so embarrassed. She was young and very irresponsible getting pregnant with a guy she didn't even know."
                          "She's in a mess!"
                          "Right. She had you for an adoption."
                          "Adoption?"
                          "Shh... The Gonzales took care of you. That's why your were named as Zion Gonzales."
                          "So why am I here? Did they find me?"
                          "Ah-ah. Your mom Jade knew all along where you were. Who adopted you and stuffs like that. She loves you so much and it was really hard for her to give you away. Maybe that's the reason she was so thin before. She kept on thinking about you and cried every night."
                          "She was miserable." I pitied mom. I couldn't imagine her suffering. 
                          "Yeah. When she met your dad again, they fell in love again and got married. They were meant to be. Like a destiny... Anyway, your dad found out about you a few days before they got married. You were already four years old at that time. Your mom decided to tell him."
                          "That long?"
                          "Yeah. And they talked to the Gonzales. Your papa Roberto and mama Edna were so kind. They allow you to meet your real parents."
                          "So that's the real story, huh?"
                          "Yeah. You're lucky you have two wonderful parents who love you so much."
                          "I guess I am." I smiled. 
                          Finally I got the whole story. Mom was right. It was really complicated.

Book II - Chapter 14

Chapter Fourteen (Unedited)
                          
                          --Kindly put your playlist here--
                          
                            "There is no such thing as a "broken family." Family is family, and is not determined by marriage certificates, divorce papers, and adoption documents. Families are made in the heart. The only time family becomes null is when those ties in the heart are cut. If you cut those ties, those people are not your family. If you make those ties, those people are your family. And if you hate those ties, those people will still be your family because whatever you hate will always be with you."  - C. Joybell C.   
                          
                          
                          Eros POV
                          "The garden looks so beautiful. The flowers are lovely and smells heavenly." Jade buried her face against my throat, her arms circled around my waist.
                          "I'm glad you like it." I hugged her so tightly and kissed her head.
                          "I love it so much. Thank you for planting all the beautiful flowers." She tiptoed and kissed my lips.
                          I kissed her back lingeringly. "All of that is for you. Because you're so beautiful and I love you so much."
                          "I love you too, Eros. You're a wonderful husband and father to our kids." She cried again.
                          "Come on, don't be sad." I wiped her tears with my thumb. "Let's go to our room and make another Zion." I pulled her slowly inside the house. 
                          She went out of my grasp. "Stop teasing me. You know I'm so sad."
                          "I'm sad too. But baby we have to be strong."
                          We were in our mansion at Georgia for a week. It was school break and Zion had to go home to his adopted parents. It was so hard for us. For five years we had Zion and now... he would leave us.
                          Last night, Jade was crying. And I couldn't help myself crying too. We had Zion slept with us, between us, hugging him so tightly. We had him and now, we were losing him again.
                          The feeling was so heavy in our hearts. We loved Zion so much and it was hard letting him go.
                          Edna was fully recovered now and backed in Georgia with his husband, Roberto. It took her a while to get rid of her disease, and finally after five years, she was back to her normal self. 
                          When Emerald found out, she was crying and had tantrums. She wouldn't leave Zion's side. 
                          We were embarrassed when we drove Zion to the Gonzales house. They prepared a welcome party for Zion. But Emerald was not impressed.
                          "He's mine! Mine! Mine!" She shouted at the Gonzales and hugged Zion. "He's my brother! Don't touch him! You're bad! F-" I covered Emerald's mouth and pulled her up in my arms. She was crying so hard. She didn't want Zion to stay with the Gonzales.
                          Jade and I apologized for what Emerald did. She was just a kid and didn't understand the situation. It was so hard to explain to her.
                          The Gonzales were so understanding and accepted our apology. They understood our situation and invited us to visit Zion everyday while we were in Georgia.
                          Zion looked so sad and angry. He didn't even cry when we bade goodbye to him. I knew he was very upset. He didn't hug us or talk to us.  He even pulled away from Emerald and ran upstairs.
                          The following day, when we visited Zion, he stayed in his room and didn't like to see us. 
                          We were worried. He didn't open the door when we knocked on his room. He shouted to leave him alone.


He was mad on us. 
                          The situation became uglier as days went by. Zion became rebellious and threw the things we gave him out of the window. He shouted 'I hate you' to us, that he didn't want to see us again, ever.
                          Roberto said that Zion was still adjusting. We would give him more time.  He would get used being home again in Georgia after few weeks.
                          But I strongly disagree. Jade and I wanted to talk to Zion, to ask him what he felt. To listen to him and make him understand the situation. But it was difficult. The Gonzales were blocking our way.
                          The Gonzales were so concerned of Zion's attitude also. They couldn't handle him anymore. They were worried that he would get sick because he was not eating well and barely leave his room.
                          During our last day in Georgia. Jade and I had a heart to heart talk with the Gonzales. This couldn't go on. Zion was so depressed.  He was not eating well and barely left his room.
                          "We talked to Zion last night." Edna started the conversation.
                          I felt a bit of hope. At least Zion was talking now.
                          "He asked why he's a Gonzales." Edna continued.
                          "He asked both of us too." Jade said and looked at me.
                          "I was expecting it - questions about his surname and his looks. He's Caucasian and we're Asians." Roberto said.
                          "We told him how we really wanted to have a baby. Where we got him for adoption and other things. He was curious and really listened well. Then he said he was confused having two parents." Edna continued.
                          I felt my heart was torn into two. I pitied my son still so young and disturbed of the situation he was in.
                          "Zion said, he is getting used having you with him."
                          My heart bled now. Our little boy. We don't want to be away from him too. We're so lonely without him.
                          "I'm sorry. But we always reminded him that there's you and Roberto, who are his parents too." Jade said.
                          "I know. He's growing up so fast. He hardly remembers the times when he was with us." Roberto said. "We want him to be happy. Edna and I realized that we can't give him the happiness he wanted."
                          The situation became so bad. I felt like Jade and I messed up their lives. 
                          "Because of that, Edna and I decided to push through with our plan."
                          "What plan?" I asked him then leaned forward resting my forearms on my knees.
                          "We're planning to go back to the Philippines."
                          My heart pounded. They're leaving the country? 
                          "What do you mean?" I asked Roberto again. 
                          "I'm sixty five and Edna just turned sixty. We're not getting any younger. Now that Edna is fully recovered, we want to enjoy and spend the rest of our lives with our families in the Philippines. We haven't seen them for a long time."
                          "What about Zion?" Jade's eyes widened. I knew the news shocked her. We felt the same. We didn't want to be away from our son.
                          "Zion will stay with you." Edna's eyes were teary. Then she forced a smile. "He's happier with you both and he adores his sister so much. Yeah. It hurts leaving him. But we just want what's best for him."
                          "Edna..." Jade touched Edna's hand.
                          "We're thinking only of his future.  We know that he'll bring the best in him if he'll stay with you. I see him in you Eros. Strong willed, assertive, adventurous and at times, unpredictable. He admires you. He talked last night about you. I could see in his eyes how proud he was in having you as his father. The same with you Jade. He loves you so much. His eyes gleamed talking about you and his sister, Emerald. We're getting old and... I have to take care of my health. What I went through was not easy. I don't want to experience that again. It's scary." 


I nodded. Not trusting myself to speak.
                          Roberto touched his wife's shoulder, caressing her back gently. "We can't focus our attention on him. Zion is young and full of energy. He needs someone like both of you. We don't want to deprive him of his happiness. We saw how miserable he is being away from you." He exhaled heavily. "He is  your son also. A Petrakis. We can't deny that. We don't want to strip him off of that heritage. It would be selfish on our part."
                          I bent my head slightly forward. "He is also a Gonzales, Roberto. Both you and Edna molded him into a wonderful boy. He's smart, caring, loving and understanding. The values that you taught him will always be there with him. We're so happy and grateful to you both. It's really fortunate that he was placed in your hands."
                          "Thank you, Eros." Edna said. "You know how much we love Zion and we think that this is for the best. We decided to grant him his wish."
                          "What wish?" Jade asked. Her eyebrows rose questioningly.
                          "To change his surname to Petrakis." Roberto said.

Book II - Chapter 15

Chapter Fifteen (UNEDITED)
                          
                          --Kindly put your playlist here--
                          
                          "When you touch a man's body, he will enjoy the moment, when you touch a man's heart he will remember it forever." - Dixie Waters
                          
                          
                          Eros' POV
                          "It's okay, baby. She will get over it some time." I told Jade, reassuring her.
                          I looked at the big black printed name of Emerald at the center of our new white leather sofa set. It was a classic Italian antique furniture and worth a fortune. 
                          "I've been explaining to her for years that writing and drawing are for papers only, not on walls, furnitures and appliances. She can't understand."
                          "She's still a kid, she won't understand." I put my arm around her shoulders, drawing her closer to me.
                          "She's putting her name everywhere. On the TV screen, on the fridge, my new bag, your laptop, Zion's cap and even outside our main door."
                          Yeah. I remembered watching TV last night. It was disturbing seeing Emerald's name at the center of the screen. I even hesitated drinking a beer, because her name was on the bottle.
                          "I guess she's overwhelmed that she knows how to write her name already."
                          "I wonder where she got that black pen. I made sure to keep all writing instruments away from her."
                          
                          ***
                          The following day
                          I went home early. It was Friday and my sister Chloe and her family would be coming over for dinner. Our families hung out often during weekends. Her husband, Iñigo was my best friend. We grew up together because our parents were close friends. 
                          "Hi baby." I kissed Jade's lips lingeringly when she opened the door for me.
                          "You're home early." 
                          "Yeah. I finished the meeting early. I need to relax before dinner. Have a nap."
                          "You should. You need a lot of energy later. You'll ruin the evening if you'll fall asleep during dinner."
                          I smiled giving her a teasing look. "Come have a nap with me."
                          "Hmm... I know what you're thinking, Mr. Petrakis."
                          "AH. You're a mind reader now, Mrs. Petrakis. Tell me, what am I thinking?" I gathered her in my arms, and held her snugly.
                          "I don't have to say it. You know it already. Go and take your nap. I'm still cooking dinner." She kissed me then pulled away from me. "Later..."
                          "Okay...okay. Where's Zion? Still in school?"
                          "Yeah. He'll be home in an hour."
                          "And Emerald?"
                          "She's in her room. Having a nap."
                          I went upstairs and headed to our room. I was tired and sleepy. I opened our bedroom door and what I found took me by surprise.
                          Emerald was behind the vanity dresser. Wearing Jade's shoes and bag. She was facing the mirror, putting lipstick on her lips - with many smudges.
                          I hid a smile. 
                          My princess is now practicing to be a lady.
                          



                          Zion's POV
                          I was staring at Maddie. 
                          She looked prettier everyday. Her blond hair was longer, her cheeks were rosy and her lips were full, red as strawberries. I tried not to like her anymore after she gave me a blacked-eye a year ago, but I couldn't help it. She's very beautiful.
                          "Zion Gonzales Petrakis." My science teacher, Miss Rhodes, called me. My eyes widened. I suddenly panicked. I was not listening to the discussion. My eyes were focused at Maddie the whole time.
                          "Yes, Miss?"
                          "Stop staring at Miss Jennings and pay attention to our discussion."
                          Darn!
                          I was embarrassed. Especially when Maddie looked at me and the whole class teased me. I melted down and wished to crawl under my desk to hide. I crossed my arms on the desk and  leaned my head onto it to hide my face. 
                          The bell rang. Thanks Jesus for saving me!
                          "You okay?" Harry asked me.
                          "Yeah. I'm fine." I gathered my things and stood up. I took my backpack from the floor and placed it on my shoulder.
                          "You don't look okay, bro." Israel, also known as Izzy, my other best buddy, tapped my shoulder. "Maddie's looking at you."
                          I looked at Maddie and she immediately looked away. 
                          "Girls." Harry shook his head. "Come on, it's Friday, let's hang out in our house."
                          "I can't. Mom wants me to go home early. My cousins are coming."
                          "How about tomorrow?"
                          "Yeah. Mom and dad are in Michigan. We can have the whole house this weekend. We can have a pool party or play Kinect games." Harry's twin sister, London butted in. They lived across our house and oftentimes, I hung out with them.
                          "Cool!" I said.
                          "What about you Izzy?"
                          "Sure, London. I'll be there."
                          London turned her attention to her best friend, Claire. "Did you ask your mom if you can come tomorrow?"
                          "Not yet. But I'll try later." Claire answered.
                          Claire Olsen was a very shy girl. Pin straight black hair, thin, so pale and yeah... Izzy thought she was pretty. She was the exact opposite of London, who was very bubbly, curly hair and overconfident.
                           I looked at Izzy and gave him a teasing look.
                          "What?" He asked me.
                          "Nothing." I answered. He had a crush on Claire and I knew, he was excited for tomorrow.
                          
                          ***
                          I entered my room feeling so relieved. Thanks God it's Friday. I'm going to play computer games till midnight. Yes!
                          I threw my bag on my bed then took my jacket off. 
                          I looked out my window and saw Maddie in her room, talking on a cellphone.
                          Shit! I immediately bent down and crawled away from the window. I didn't have a face to show her anymore. I was embarrassed at school today and I didn't want another of it today.
                          Very slowly, I creeped at the side of the window and pulled down the blinds. Whew!
                          I went to the bathroom and peed, leaving the door opened. Then I washed my hands and looked at my face in the mirror. Darn it! I have a new pimple on my nose!


My bedroom door suddenly opened and Emerald entered. "Zion, look who's here!"
                          I went outside the bathroom and saw my little cousins, Carter and Kimberly - The Monteiros. 
                          Carter was the same age as Emerald, six years old. Kimberly was about a year younger. The three of them got along very well. 
                          "Hi, Zion. Can I borrow that sword?" Carter pointed at my lightsaber display rack.
                          I took the blue one and handed it to him. "Where's Daniel?"
                          "Downstairs." Kimberly said, jumping on my bed. "He's playing with Happy."
                          Daniel was their youngest brother. He was hyperactive, always moving, running and bouncing. He had a habit of breaking things. He broke plates, frames and vases every time he went to my grandparents house. Last month, grandpa Markos' forehead was bleeding. Daniel poked his head with a spoon.
                          "Hey look who's here!" Emerald shouted, looking outside the window. "It's Maddie!"
                          OH NO! Emerald pulled up the blinds. This is embarrassing.
                          "Emerald, pull it down!"
                          "Why?" She turned her head towards me.
                          "I said, pull the blinds down!"
                          "Hmp!" She frowned and shouted. "Hi Maddie!" She was waving at Maddie now. 
                          Darn it!
                          "Hi, Emerald." I heard Maddie said. Her voice was soft and sweet - like an angel.
                          Carter and Kimberly ran towards the window and joined Emerald. They were waving at Maddie too.
                          This is humiliating. Please... not again. 
                          "You're a good dancer, Maddie." Emerald continued.
                          "Oh! You've seen me dance?"
                          "Yeah. Twice."
                          I went to the side of the window. I was very careful that Maddie wouldn't see me.
                          "Really? Where?" Maddie asked.
                          "In Zion's cellphone."
                          Emerald shouted before I pulled the blinds down.
                          Darn it, Emmie!

Maddie is almost perfect.

He came from an Arabian descent and his very dark hair and thick eyebrows made the girls went gaga over him.  Izzy was humble about his looks. He said that he looked very ordinary in their country.

                          "It's only a beer with 5% alcohol." Harry insisted. "No one's going to tell them. It's our secret."

"Mom sent me to tell you to go home."

                          It was Eros.

Normally, I didn't work on Saturdays, but Mr. Vogel would be leaving tomorrow, therefore we had to finalize the deal today. Our two-hour meeting stretched to six hours discussing and revising the business plan.  
                          I was surprised to see a red Ferrari in our driveway. I was impressed actually. It was the latest edition of the Ferrari supercars. I was contemplating buying the exact car a month ago. But because I was extremely busy, I always put it at back of my mind.
                          I wonder who our visitor is? Maybe my cousin Kobe.
                          I heard laughter. Jade's laughter and Sapphire. Then there was Emerald's high pitch voice followed by a man's deep voice. 
                          No. That's not Kobe. 
                          I opened the door, excited to join the fun. After a long day at work, I needed to unwind and enjoy. It was Saturday and the kids could sleep a bit late tonight. 
                          The laughter was getting louder as I came inside. It was like music in my ears and my mood immediately lightened. I was glad that my family was happy.
                          Whoever this visitor is, must be someone very close to our family. Perhaps I'm going to open one of my vintage wine collection tonight.

                          My mood immediately switched sharply to anger. 
                          What the hell is he doing in here!
                          Everyone immediately went silent and stared at me - especially Jade, whose eyes opened wide, observing my reaction. I knew that look, liked scolding me to behave and not to do anything stupid at that moment. She often did it to our kids, and now she was doing it to me.
                          Damn! She expects me to calm down after seeing this demented doctor? Why is he here? Why can't he leave Jade alone?

                          "He did?" I felt a bit of hope hearing that. I was certain that Eros was so angry at me now. I was afraid he wouldn't forgive me for slapping him. God! What was I thinking. Why did I slap him?
                          Zion sat beside me on the bed and caressed my back, comforting me. "It's okay, mom. Don't cry too hard."
                          "Where is he?"
                          "I left him in my room."
                          Maybe he wouldn't sleep here in our room tonight. If that would happen, it would be the first time since we got married. Oh... what is wrong with me. Why did I slap him.
                          I was really upset with Eros. It hurt so much that he didn't trust me. If he really loved me, then he should have trusted me.
                          I loved him so much and told him that too many times, every single day. I married him... we have two kids. We were so happy together and shared everything, our hopes and dreams, our plans for the future, our family and our lives. Then why of a sudden, he doubted my feelings for him? He didn't trust me enough. What hurt most was that, he thought I loved Joseph, until now.
                          Eros haven't change. He was still jealous of Joseph. I explained to him too many times that Joseph was just a friend, like a brother. But he refused to listen. He didn't want me to mention Joseph's name, ever. Joseph Nevine was part of my life... and my sister's. For years we grew up together in New Jersey. He was the brother that I never had for eighteen years. If Eros would deprive me of that, it was like depriving me part of my past. He had to accept my friendship with Joseph and learn to trust me.
                          Joseph already apologized about what happened in the past but Eros wouldn't accept it. It was hard to convince Eros that Joseph wouldn't do anything to ruin our marriage. Why should he feel so insecure with Joseph? I have given him everything, my love and my life. We got married and vowed to love and cherish each other for the rest of our lives. We have our kids - the fruits of our unconditional love. How could he doubted my love for him?
                          Oh God. And now, I just slapped him. I regretted doing that. I was not able to hold my temper. I shouldn't have done that. 
                          I recalled again and again what Eros said that made me slapped him. 'He was stripping you with his eyes in front of me. He wanted to fuck you!' The word 'fuck you... fuck you...' was like a record player that kept on ringing in my mind.
                          "Are you okay?" Zion asked.
                          I shrugged my shoulders.
                          "You should sleep early so you'll feel better in the morning. Tomorrow when you and dad have a clear head, you can talk about it."
                          I nodded.
                          Zion tucked me into bed and kissed my cheeks. "I love you mom. Don't worry, okay? Everything will be fine."


"Thank you. I love you too."
                          I remembered him lying beside me  and hugged me before I drifted to sleep.
                          I woke up at midnight alone on the bed. I was not used sleeping alone and I missed Eros so badly. 
                          I felt so bad and anxious. I shouldn't have slapped him. I have to talk to him now and say sorry. I went out of bed and looked for him. He was not in the guest room and not in Zion's room either. I was afraid that he left the house and spent the night somewhere. My heart was pounding so hard that I could hear it in my ears. Fear. Worry. Anxiety. Where is he?
                           I went to Emerald's room and saw him sleeping beside Emerald. I was relieved.
                          
                          
                          Eros' POV
                          "You deserve that slap, man." My bestfriend, Iñigo Monteiro said. I woke up so early and called him for a kickboxing match. 
                          "Yeah. If I was Jade, I should have slapped you twice and poke your head with a slipper." Chloe butted in. She've just arrived with her youngest son, Daniel. "You just showed that you didn't trust her and that hurts her feelings."
                          "She married you man. You have two kids. She gave up her career so she can take care of you and the kids. Still, you're doubting her love for you?"
                          "You're a selfish, egoistic, possessive, jealous..." Chloe continued. 
                          "Hey!" I snapped at my sister. She had no filter with her words when it came to me.
                          "Sorry, brother. I just don't understand why are you so insecure with that guy, huh?"
                          "Excuse me? I don't have any insecurities with anyone, particularly with that lunatic doctor. Both of you don't understand what I'm saying. Jade is still into him!" I argued with them. 
                          Iñigo shook his head. "How could you say that?"
                          "The way she acted and her eyes sparkled whenever she looked at him. He even made her laugh at his silly jokes.  Dammit! It was not even funny." 
                          "She's just being friendly and polite. We girls do that. Laugh at silly jokes." Chloe said while chasing her toddler son. "Your jealousy will surely kill you."
                          "You need to talk to Jade." Iñigo tapped my shoulder. "Be a man."
                          ***
                          Before I went home, I had a coffee with Donovan and my head security Rob Brent at Starbucks.
                          "Nah... what she did is wrong. You're a man, her husband. Where's the respect there if she slapped you." Rob said.
                          "She didn't mean to do it. I know Jade, she's an angel." Donovan argued with Rob, then turned to me. "You provoked her and that made her slap you."
                          "What she did is domestic violence." Rob reasoned out. "That's not allowed in the country, man."
                          "It's not intentional. She felt being attacked and that's her way of defending herself." Donovan still defended Jade.
                          Rob shook his head and faced me. "You should give her a lesson though. If you forgive her right away, she'll get used to it and think that it's fine to hurt you physically. You know girls and how their mind works. Let her suffer a bit."
                          "How?" I asked.
                          "Ignore her for two weeks." Rob suggested.
                          "Two weeks? I can't bear not talking to Jade even in a single day." The thought was so unpleasant. It made my heart feel so heavy.
                          "Okay, make it a week, man. And sleep in the guest room."
                          "No, I don't think I can do it. I won't feel comfortable sleeping without Jade. Last night was a torture already, how much more a week without her. It would be like famine, man."
                          "Yeah, at first. But don't worry, you'll get used to it."
                          "That's a good idea." Donovan said. "The best thing to do is talk to Jade and patch up."
                          "That's weak. What she did is something that you should not tolerate. Be a man and do it" Rob said.
                          I drove home thinking of what Rob said.
