Book II - Chapter 19

Chapter Nineteen (UNEDITED)
                          
                          --Kindly put your playlist here--
                          
                          Forgiveness is a key element in healthy long-term marriages. It is the oil that lubricates a love relationship, and it's an oil we need daily. Forgiveness is not a one-time event; it's an attitude of wanting to partner with your spouse in spite of his or her imperfections and irritations. (David and Claudia Arp)
                          
                          Jade's POV
                          Mom arrived in the house with Sapphire, so early the following morning bringing her homemade chocolate muffins. It was Zion's favourite. 
                          We were having breakfast and I couldn't help but told them about what happened last night.
                          "You shouldn't have brought Joseph here." Mom said to Sapphire.
                          "Why not? I don't see any problem there." Sapphire lifted one eyebrow. 
                          "You know how jealous Eros is with Joseph."
                          "He's acting like a kid. He should learn to overcome his insecurities." Sapphire sipped her hot choco. "Joseph wants to see Jade. He's like a family to us. If Eros really loves Jade and he cares about her, and us as his family, then he should accept our friendship withJoseph."
                          "I know. But we should also understand him - his feelings." Mom answered.
                          "But what about our feelings, and Jade's? It's not reasonable to give up our friendship with Joseph just because of his jealousy."
                          Mom shook her head, disagreeing with Sapphire. "We have to adjust."
                          "Nope. That is so wrong mom. No...no... no... Just because he's the great and lordly billionaire, Petrakis, who graduated with flying colours in Harvard and speak multi languages, we're the one to adjust and tolerate his stubborn attitude? No way."
                          "Sapphire!" Mom scolded my sister. "He's your brother in-law."
                          "Sorry, Jade." Sapphire gave me an apologetic look then bit a chunk of cheese. "There's no reason for him to get jealous. He's married to you. He got you 24/7 and you have kids. He's being irrational."
                          I heaved a sigh then sipped my coffee. "He has some weaknesses, he's not a perfect man, Saph. This thing about Joseph is just too hard for him to  get over with."
                          "He's so insecure with Joseph." Sapphire put a whole chicken nugget inside her mouth. 
                          "Just jealous." Mom corrected Sapphire.
                          "Okay, jealous. Whatever." Sapphire turned to me. "You have to talk about Joseph. Make him understand that Joseph is not a threat to your marriage."
                          "I tried. But you know that the mere mention of Joseph's name made him upset already."
                          "Yeah, I know." Sapphire smiled. She was a savage girl. She enjoyed teasing Eros by asking Emerald 'Who is Baby Jesus' daddy?'
                          "It's good that you slapped him. I hope it was hard enough to align his crooked brain." Sapphire continued.
                          "Sapphire. What's wrong with you? The other day, you said you love Eros and he's the best brother ever because he gave you an iPhone 7. And now, you talking against him!" Mom scolded my sister, again. 
                          "I love Eros as my brother, as well as Joseph. I care about him, he's part of our family now.  I just want him to change. That's all."
                          Mom nodded and turned to me. "You shouldn't have slapped him Jade. That's a bad thing to do. Apologize and tell him that you regretted what you did. You can't blame him for being so mad at you."


"I know. I regretted what I did. That was a very bad thing to do. And now, I'm so worried. I can't stand him being mad at me. My heart feels so heavy. I hope we'll be able to talk and settle this today."
                          "I'll keep my fingers cross, Dee."
                           ***
                          Eros arrived at around nine in the morning.  I just had a shower and  I was sitting behind the vanity dresser combing my hair. 
                          He entered our bedroom without even looking at me. He dumped his bag on the floor then sat down on the bed and kicked his shoes off. 
                          I could feel the tension between us. I wanted to work out immediately what we could do to make it go away. The situation was so uncomfortable.
                          "Have you eaten your breakfast?" I asked him.
                          He stiffened and murmured. "Yup." Then he stood up and opened one of his closets. His eyes were so cold and proud.
                          He was still upset. 
                          I stood up and went closer to him. But he was quick in moving away before I could touch him. I felt rejected. Hurt. Unloved.
                          "Um... where's my kiss?" I still had the courage to ask. Eros was a sweet guy. He never failed kissing me whenever he arrived home.
                          He looked at me then gave me a kiss on my lips that barely touch. It was not a sweet kiss... more like someone being forced or obligated to do it. 
                          "Can we talk?" I asked him. I wanted to sort out the tension between us. It felt so heavy in my heart and I wanted it to go away. "Please, honey..." I pleaded and touched his forearm. I could feel his muscles tensed suddenly under my fingertips. 
                          "Not now, Jade." He said and brushed my hand away. His eyes were full of remoteness. He looked like a stranger at that moment. 
                          "I'm so sorry, honey. Please... forgive me..."
                          He held up a hand to silence me. "I said not now." His voice was very authoritative and distant - creating a barrier between us. He reminded me of the Eros I first worked with. So arrogant, cold and heartless.
                          I stepped back and clasped my hands together. There was no point of insisting for a talk right now. We have to wait until we both have calmed down.
                          "I understand." I almost whispered. I could feel his sharp eyes assessing me before he went to the bathroom. 
                          The heavy feeling was too much. I felt like I was being punished. But I have to be strong. Soon, we would settle this and everything would be back to normal.
                          Space. He needs space right now and I'm going to give him that.
                          
                          Eros' POV
                          It was after lunch and Jade haven't arrived yet. When I went out of the bathroom this morning, I saw her note on the bedside table. She wanted a time by herself - to think. She would be at her mom's place to help with the gardening.
                          To think. She really needed to think and analyze what happened. 
                          Well, I hope she'll figure out what she did wrong. She defended that lunatic doctor and slapped me. 
                          I looked at my watch, it was three o'clock. She was gone for six hours. I looked at Emerald who was sprawled on the floor, playing with our dog, Happy. 
                          "Emmie."
                          Emerald's head went up. "Yes, daddy?"
                          I put down my laptop on the center table and stood up. "Come here, princess. Let's call your mom, okay? Ask her what time she'll be home."  


I went to where the phone was and about to pressed my mother in-law's number when Emerald said stubbornly. "Why don't you talk to mom? You're holding the phone already, daddy."
                          I exhaled heavily. "I can't. Your mom is mad at me."
                          Emerald rolled on her stomach and grabbed her iPad. "She's not. Mommy doesn't know how to get mad."
                          "Emmie. Be a good girl princess and do what I say."
                          Emerald pouted and stood up. "Why are you not talking to mommy?"
                          "We have a little misunderstanding. It's something that parents do sometimes and kids your age don't understand that yet."
                          "Oh-ohhh... but you're not divorcing, right?"
                          I was taken aback by what Emerald said. What the hell!
                          "Of course not, Emmie. Who gave you that idea?" The thought of divorcing Jade was very alarming and disturbing to my whole being. I would never ever let that thing happen to us. 
                          "Spongebob." Emmie answered innocently. "Spongebob divorced his wife because... she did not laugh at his jokes."
                          "What? Couple don't get divorce just because of that, Emmie."
                          "Oh... Spongebob did." Emerald insisted. "He heard a man laughing at his jokes under the bed."
                          Oh God. 
                          I pressed Ruby's number and gave the receiver to Emerald.
                          "Hello, Grandma. The muffins are delicious... Happy likes it too... can you bring strawberry muffin next time? You're going to watch a movie? Can I go with you? Zion is not here. He's at Harry's house... Remember that movie when..."
                          I held Emerald's small arm, reminding her the reason why we called her grandma. She suddenly stared at me then raised her hand up to silence me. 
                          "Talk to your mom." I whispered at her softly, making sure that I wouldn't be heard on the other line. "Tell her to give the phone to your mom."
                          "What?" Emerald asked me.
                          "Shhh. Talk to your mom. Ask her what time she'll be home." I whispered again, making hand signals at the same time. 
                          "What?" Emerald asked me again. "Why are you whispering, daddy. I can't understand you. Ooops, sorry grandma."
                          Emmie!!!
                          "Ask what time your mom will be home." I said in my normal voice. I didn't care anymore if Ruby heard me. 
                          "Okay." Emerald said and asked her grandma. She listened carefully then focused her attention on me again. "Grandma said that mom just dropped by this morning. She went downtown to meet a friend."
                          "Who?"
                          "I don't know." Emerald answered me. 
                          I rolled my eyes and stared back at her. "Ask your grandma."
                          "Grandma doesn't know also, daddy."
                          I was bothered. Very disturbed. Who the hell is she meeting with right now? I looked at my watch again. It was three thirty already.
                          Emerald put down the phone and went to grab her play doctor kit on top of the counter table. Then she sprawled on the carpeted floor beside Happy. She was auscultating Happy's heart sounds.
                          I closed my eyes and leaned my back on the armchair. Crazy images started corrupting my brain. What if Jade's spending her day with the lunatic doctor? He's still here in New York for sure. What if they're having lunch together... perhaps having coffee or strolling in the park? Talking. Laughing. Holding hands... Kissing.


No! NO! NO!
                          Fucking Shit! No. No way. I'm getting so paranoid. Jade wouldn't do that. I knew her so will. She couldn't do that to me and to our kids. She loves us. 
                          I was staring at my watch, counting the minutes left before four. I need to call her now or else I'll go crazy. 
                          Shit! I shouldn't have listen to Rod's stupid suggestion in ignoring Jade. He didn't know anything about women. He was still single at fifty! Dammit. I can't punish Jade, I love her. She's the love of my life.
                          The main door opened. My heart leaped up thinking it was Jade. But it was Zion with his friends, Harry and Izzy.
                          "Harry!" Emerald shouted. Her eyes grew bigger. I didn't like the idea of Emerald admiring this British boy, Harry too much. She was still too young. And Harry was kinda bad boy. He initiated playing pranks at school, get into trouble sometimes and his parents were called twice in the principal's office.  I just wished that in the future, she would get over her childhood crush on him.
                          "Hi Emmie." Harry winked at her then turned to me, smiling. "Hello Mr. Petrakis. Nice hair."
                          Nice hair? I touched my hair. What is wrong my hair?
                          "Good afternoon, sir." Izzy said. I liked this Arab boy better. He was a very smart, athletic and a good kid. He was a good influence to Zion.
                          I nodded at the two boys before they turned and followed Zion upstairs - to his room. 
                          My mind went back to Jade. I have to call her now. I pressed her number, but it was busy. Then again... and again... 
                          Dammit. Where the hell is she? Who's the friend she's meeting with?

Book II - Chapter 20

Chapter Twenty (UNEDITED)
                          
                          --Kindly put your playlist here--
                          
                          Love is patient, love is kind. It does not envy, it does not boast, it is not proud. It does not dishonor others, it is not self-seeking, it is not easily angered, it keeps no record of wrongs. Love does not delight in evil but rejoices with the truth. It always protects, always trusts, always hopes, always perseveres. - The Holy Bible, 1 Corinthians 13:4-7
                          
                          Jade's POV
                          I was feeling so down. Unhappy. Nothing could make me smile at the moment. Eros was mad at me and it brought heaviness in my heart. I didn't like this feeling. A combination of sadness, worries and regret. 
                          I wished I had a time machine so I could turn back the time where this conflict started. I could have handled the situation well. 
                          I was eager for Eros and Joseph to become friends. I thought after seven years, that was enough time for Eros to forgive and forget what happened in the past. But I was wrong. It wouldn't make a difference if it would be a year, ten years or a hundred years... Eros would still hate Joseph.
                          I heaved a long sigh. My spirit was in chaos and my mind reeled with confusion. What am I going to do to resolve this issue?
                          Communication. Experts said that it was  the key in having a successful marriage. 
                          But Eros didn't want to talk to me. I understand that he was not yet ready and he needed space.
                          I drove to my mom's house. I was desperate to talk to someone... anyone. A friend. Someone who understood me. That would be Rachel.
                          I stopped the car in my mom's driveway and texted Rachel Niarchos. She became my best friend since we first met, seven years ago. We were both pregnant at that time. Me with Emerald, and she with her eldest child, Athena. Her Greek husband, Ares Niarchos was Eros' childhood friend.
                          Rachel and I were the same. We were able to relate each other's hardships and struggles in life. Sharing our experiences made us understand what we went through and drew us closer like sisters. 
                          I was talking to my mom when Rachel called me. 
                          "What happened? 
                          "Oh, I feel so bad of myself, Rachel. I'm a terrible person."
                          "That sounds serious."
                          "It is."
                          Rachel paused then said. "Let's meet at the Sweetdreamer Café right now." 
                          "Are you sure? Ares won't mind?"
                          "He won't. He's teaching the kids to swim. But I have to be back at four to prepare for our dinner date later."
                          "Oh, fine. Thank you so much, Rachel."
                          "Nah... What are friends are for."
                          Rachel and I met at Sweetdreamer Café. The Café was our favorite place to hang out. It was one of the most beautiful cafes  in the city with a calm and relaxing ambience.  It was secluded from the very busy city life. A double storied cafe, exquisitely decorated with verandah seating. Beautiful flowers in different kind and lush greenery surrounded it. Their coffee was amazingly delicious as well as their food. The owner/manager, Neilani Alejandrino was a good friend of ours. A romance author and a Wattpad Star. She wrote beautiful love stories that kept us inspired and believed in true love. 


"You did the right thing by giving him space. I can see that he's really hurt and angry. Showering with apologies and  explanations while he's very emotional is not a good idea. It will just upset him more. It's unlikely that he will respond in your favor. He just needs some time to process what's happened... the situation and his feelings." Neilani said.
                          "How will I know that it's time to approach him?" I asked.
                          "You will. You can tell from his mood and actions." She took a sip of her coffee and continued. "Just wait for him to calm down, Jade."
                          "Okay. I will." 
                          "I did the same thing when I had a fight with Ares the other month. Remember?" Rachel turned to me and I nodded. 
                          I remembered her telling me about their fight. Her phone was in silent mode while she went shopping with her kids. Ares was calling her because he cancelled his business appointment so he could spend time with them. Ares got so mad that Rachel didn't answer her phone. He told her when she got home to throw her phone because it was useless, she could not be reached.
                          "Don't argue the point with him. Accept that what you did is wrong. At the moment, don't try to explain it away and making excuses. That would only make him more angrier and hurt, just focus on taking responsibility and making amends." Neilani said.
                          "Yeah. You know men and their oversized egos. Especially that we both married Greek men, with too much pride." Rachel butted in.
                          Neilani laughed. "That's true. I can relate to both of you. My dad is half Greek."
                          "Oh really?" 
                          "My dad was very strict and a disciplinarian to us his kids. He was hardworking, a very good provider to his family, faithful and a loving husband. Basically, most men are like that, whatever race, culture or religion. Men really wants to win the love of a girl  he treated like a princess, to win a fight for her, rescue her from dragons or wicked witch or some other great danger, to marry her, and to live happily ever after."

                          Claire Olsen had a great crush on Zion Petrakis since the first time she laid eyes on him. But Zion had his eyes glued at the school's 'It girl' Maddie Jennings.                           The music started playing and Emerald walked passed beside me. "Hi mommy. Happy Anniversary." She looked so pretty in a purple dress. She had a basket with her full of red petals and was throwing it on the aisle. 
                          Zion appeared beside me, looking so handsome in a tuxedo. He looked taller than I thought. I was even looking up at him. 
                          He kissed my cheek. "Happy 10th wedding anniversary mom."
                          Tears suddenly tears pooled in my eyes as I looked at Zion, then my eyes transferred at Eros who was waiting for me at the other end of the aisle, smiling. 
                          "Don't cry." Zion said.
                          Too bad. I couldn't hold my tears. It was running down my cheeks non-stop. All the emotions I felt during the day, thinking that everyone forgot our wedding anniversary. Especially to Eros, who made me so upset. 
                          Zion gave me his handkerchief. "Come on, mom. Dad is waiting."
                          I wiped my tears and slowly, Zion walked with me down the aisle. 
                          ♪And darling I will be loving you 'til we're 70And baby my heart could still fall as hard at 23♬♭    And I'm thinking 'bout how people fall in love in mysterious ways Maybe just the touch of a hand♬♮    Oh me I fall in love with you every single dayAnd I just wanna tell you I am♩♪ 
                          My tears were falling down my cheeks again as I looked at Eros. We held eyes as I walked towards him.
                          He looked so strikingly handsome in a white tuxedo. After ten years, he was still the same, the man I loved and married. That teasing look and smug smile. Charming, caring, loving and a passionate guy. 
                          "You remembered?" I said when Eros took my hand, away from Zion.
                          "Of course. Why would I forget our special day?" Eros said, holding me close to him. "Happy tenth wedding anniversary baby. I love you so much."
                          We kissed and everyone clapped. 
                          Later, the ceremony started. Eros and I renewed our vows. 
                          "Jade, 10 years ago, I pledged my love and commitment to you, but it seems like only yesterday. I promised to love you, honor you, comfort and keep you. I pledges to be by your side in sickness and in health, in times of want, and times of plenty, for better or worse, for the rest of our lives. We have had all of those things, and you have been by my side as we created a family, a home, and a life together. Today, at the beginning of our 11th year as husband and wife, in the presence of God, and our family and friends, I renew my vows to you, pledging my eternal love for you, and eagerly awaiting what life may bring us."
                          "Eros, you are my hero, and my love. My hopes and dreams are forever intermingled with yours. Today I recommit myself to you and our marriage. I promise to encourage and inspire you, to laugh with you, and to comfort you in times of sorrow and struggle. I promise to love you in good times and in bad, when life seems easy and when it seems hard, when our love is simple, and when it is an effort. I promise to cherish you, and to always hold you in highest regard. These things I give to you today, and all the days of our life."

Book II - Chapter 28

Chapter Twenty Eight (Unedited)
                          
                          --Kindly put your playlist here--
                          "Just because we don't talk doesn't mean I don't think about you. I'm just trying to distance myself because I know I can't have you." - Wiz Khalifa
                          
                          Zion's POV
                          "You know what? If you keep on writing love letters for Claire, I won't be wondering if someday you'll fall in love with her." Harry said when Izzy went to the toilet.
                          "Me? Are you kidding me?" I chuckled. "She's beautiful... but she's not the type of girl that I would hang out with."
                          "So, you find Claire beautiful, huh?" Harry gave me a malicious teasing look. Then laughed so hard when I gave him an odd look. "Be careful not to let Izzy hear you that."
                          I shook my head and continued writing the letter. "Stop it man, I told you. She's not my type."
                          "Oh yeah. You're obsession with Maddie Jennings. Why don't you court her? She's just waiting for you."
                          Obsession? Hardly. 
                          My crush on Maddie was slowly fading. I just stopped thinking of her. I couldn't remember since when, but it had been too long. 
                          Maddie was a pretty and talented girl. She danced really well and that made her very popular. Most boys in school have a crush on her. And yeah, I was one of them.
                          But now that I'm fifteen, my perception of beauty changed. I realized that outer appearance doesn't mean anything. What's important is the personality.
                          "Look at her, bro. She keeps on glancing at you." Harry whispered, leaning towards me. We were in the cafeteria. Waiting for our next class.
                          "Really?" I said. My attention was still focused on the letter I was making.
                          "You know what? It's obvious that she likes you. Act now before someone does." Harry continued, snapping his fingers in front of me. "Hey! You're not even listening."
                          "Wait. I'm almost done." 
                          I don't know. I enjoy writing letters for Claire. It just makes me happy. I was glad to help Izzy too. He found it hard to express his feelings for Claire in writing.
                          Something pulled me to look at the door. It was Claire. I couldn't understand. Every time I saw her, she made my heart leap. Maybe because of writing letters for her - made me feel connected to her.
                          Claire caught me looking at her, then she glanced away. She always did that. Never look at me. Sometimes I wondered. What did I do wrong? She seemed avoiding me. 
                          "Hey. You done?" Harry tapped my shoulder.
                          "Yeah." I said, folding the letter and put it inside the envelope.
                          "Let's go. It's almost time." Harry stood up pulling his backpack. "Dang it! Izzy is still in the toilet. I'm sure he's stomach is upset again."
                          
                          Emerald's POV
                          "What happened? You're dripping wet!" Mom said when she saw me getting out of the car. My uniform was wet, my socks and shoes. I was muddy, filthy and smelled really bad.
                          "I fell on a river." I walked to the front door heavy-footed, dragging my bag on the floor. 
                          "What? How did it happen?" Mom was getting frantic again. I didn't want her to worry. She had too many things in her mind already. Taking care of baby Crystal, me, Zion and dad. And the house. I didn't want to give her stress. Because stress leads to disease.


I shrugged my shoulders. "I missed a step."
                          Mom looked confused but stopped questioning me. Thanks God. I can go up to my room now. I need to study.
                          The truth was, I rescued an old lady's cat drowning in the river near our school. I was just in time before the cat caught by the current and swept away.
                          "Go, take a bath sweetie. I'll prepare soup and sandwiches for you." Mom said and went to the kitchen.
                          I had a bad day. I got one wrong in my Math exam. Regina got perfect. 
                          I hate Regina. She's always the teachers pet. I don't want to be defeated by her. In anything. I'm tired of always second.
                          I was ascending the stairs, stomping my wet shoes, feeling so tired and muddy when I met Zion and Harry. Shocks!
                          "Hey, you stink!" Zion exclaimed, blocking my way. "What happened?"
                          I was intensely embarrassed that Harry saw me like this. 
                          "I rescued a cat drowning in the river."
                          "Really?" Zion chuckled. I knew he didn't believe me. "Did you give it a CPR?" He and Harry laughed together.
                          "Get out of my way." I pushed Zion and went up running. Ugh! I hate my brother sometimes. 
                          "You still look cute, Emerald." I heard Harry shouted. At least, that made me feel a bit better. 
                          
                          Eros POV
                          "Honey, Edna is inviting us to the Philippines on her 60th birthday. I told Zion about it and he's really excited to see his Mama and Papa. It's summer break for the kids so we can stay longer and explore the country." Jade sat on the bed beside me. I just arrived from the office and so tired after a whole day negotiation with the Russian client. 
                          "When was the last time he saw them in person, a year ago?" 
                          "Yeah, when they visited the US. But Zion likes to meet the Gonzales family and relatives in the Philippines. He feels that they are his too."
                          "Of course. The Gonzales will always be a family to him - to us. Well, It's time for Zion to visit the Philippines." I hugged Jade, kissing her forehead.
                          "You mean, we're all going, right?" Her eyes widened with excitement. 
                          "No."
                          "No?" The excitement on Jade's face was replaced with disappointment. "Why? We can't just let Zion travel alone. He's still fifteen, a minor."
                          "He's not a kid anymore. He's tough."
                          "No way, Eros. No way." Jade stood up and put her hands on her waist, facing me squarely. "I can't let my baby travel alone."
                          She was angry. She often called me Eros if she was angry. 
                          "He's not a baby, for God's sake, J-A-D-E." I said emphasizing her name.
                          She put her hands on her chest, her emerald eyes glaring at me. "You're angry."
                          Look who's talking. I heaved a long sigh. "You were angry first. You called me Eros."
                          "Honey... can't you take a few weeks off? It's for Zion. Besides, we really need a vacation." She was hugging me now and raining kisses on my face. It was really hard to say no especially if she was acting like this - so sweet, loving and caring. 
                          "Of course. You see, I have to close that Russian deal. It's very important to get that project. We worked so hard on it already." Jade looked really sad and I didn't like it. "But tomorrow, I'll talk to the board, see if I can turnover it to anyone of them. Okay, baby?"
                          She nodded, smiling and hugged me tightly. "I'm sure anyone will handle it well, honey. I'm so excited to go to the Philippines." She kissed my lips sweetly then whispered. "Do you like a massage?"
                          Great. Just what I needed. I pulled her in my arms and kissed her properly. "What kind of massage are you offering?"
                          She giggled with laughter and screamed when I tickled her. 
                          Jade knew I couldn't say NO to her. I spoiled her too much and I loved it.
